body.p: Editors may review and correct objects owned by other users even if no special rights for the object were granted to them. Thus they can review and improve the quality of the data.

ul.li: Can edit all items in a corpus where he or she has the editor rights.
Can add or remove texts/objects within a corpus.
Can assign a Updater or Reader status to other users, but only for individual database objects.
Can, technically, change his or her own status as a Reader or an Updater. This is irrelevant though, because the user role "Editor" takes precedence ( as in the case of the Admin).

In case the corpus was created by someone else, Editor can modify individual texts/objects, but is attributed a guest role for the corpus itself (cannot edit the corpus passport data, or edit updaters/readers for an entire corpus).
Cannot create new corpora within a project.
Lemma view: can view Lemma entries but not edit them or add new ones.
Thesaurus view: can view the Thesaurus entries but not edit them or add new ones.
